The FWG QR scanner is an app with which you can call up information on important locations in the Frankenwald-Gymnasium Kronach with the help of a QR code, which can be found at the locations themselves. The development takes place in the form of an open source project, so that you can view the source code of the app on Github at any time.

Development team:\nQ12 computer science course at the Frankenwald-Gymnasium Kronach consisting of Maxim Balajan, Daniel Becker, Tobias Bittner, Dennis Eckert, Nico Fröba, Philipp Möckel, Niklas Schoberth, David Schuberth and Ben Welsch

Use of the app
Scan a QR code you have found. If the scan was successful, the current station and its information should be displayed. If you want to go back, click on the arrow in the top left.
Click on the 3 lines in the top left to get to the navigation menu.
Click the map icon to get to the map.
Click the 3 dots in the top right to get to the settings.

Use of the app
Click on the 3 lines in the top left to get to the navigation menu.
Choose Scan.
Now scan a QR code you have found. If the scan was successful, the current station and its information should be displayed (information is only available in German).
If you want to go back, click the arrow in the top left.
Click the map icon to get to the map.
Click the 3 dots in the top right to get to the settings.

Information about the map\nPermission from a teacher is required to access the map. You can get access by scanning a QR code generated by the teacher. Once you\'ve unlocked the map, you\'ll be able to see the parts of the map where you scanned the stations. The parts of the map that are a neighboring station to a station that has already been completed or that do not correspond to any station are highlighted in gray. The arrows point to the next station.

Information about the settings
General > Mode: Choice between school rally and information mode
General > Dark mode: Settings for the appearance of the app (automatically follows the system settings)
Quality > Video quality / Image quality: Set the resolution of videos and images (a low resolution is recommended for use with mobile data)
